title: Aliquippa teen accused in fatal shooting turns self in
content:
An Aliquippa teenager accused of killing one teen and suspected in the death of another turned himself in to police Wednesday afternoon, Beaver County officials said.
Lawrence “Pooh Rat” Reddick Jr., 17, was charged Sunday in the shooting death of William Cade Booher, 17, of Beaver.
Police said Reddick and two other teens — Deontae Jones and Ronald Harvey “Reno” Foster Jr., both 17 of Aliquippa and members of the high school's football team — conspired to rob Booher and 18-year-old Dane Mathesius when Booher and Mathesius drove to Aliquippa on Thursday to sell the trio marijuana.
Mathesius was found shot to death Tuesday in a backyard on Irwin Street. He had been missing since the Thursday shooting. Authorities said Monday that Mathesius may have been a victim.
Police said Reddick, Jones and Foster set up the deal to rob the others. Reddick has not been charged in Mathesius' death.
Police on Sunday charged Reddick with homicide, three counts of robbery, two counts each of aggravated assault and reckless endangerment, and one count of discharging a firearm into an occupied structure.
Jones and Foster were charged Monday with homicide, conspiracy and robbery. Foster is charged with criminal use of a communication facility.
Megan Guza is a Tribune-Review staff writer. Reach her at 412-380-8519 or mguza@tribweb.com.
